attributes.action: Give work permits to illegal immigrants living in the UK for over 3 years.
attributes.background:
UK Government should give work permits to illegal immigrants who have been in the UK for over 3 years.
These illegal immigrants are from war torn or poverty stricken nations. To send them back to their countries is sending them to their deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
United Kingdom is a nation of compassionate, loving, hardworking, generous, hospitable and peaceful people.
Giving work permits to illegal immigrants who have been in the UK for over 3 years and have no criminal record will lead to:
1. Increase in UK's work force
2. Increase in UK's sources of income.
3. Added values to British rich cultures
4. Increase in UK's leading role as the most compassionate and generous nation on earth.

attributes.action: Allocate UK share of the EU science budget to UKRI for transnational research
attributes.background: Research & Innovation helps drive our economy.  Collaboration with international partners is essential to maintain the world-leading standard of UK research.  The UK has been one of the top beneficiaries from EU research and innovation framework funding programmes, enabling this activity.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaving the EU will jeopardise this support to quality and quantity of UK research.  The UK share of this fund should be protected for use for this purpose going forward.  Mechanisms most appropriate to the political situation will take time to clarify, yet the commitment to support this area of economic growth-driving should be made now.

http://tinyurl.com/jeyqy2k 
http://tinyurl.com/gwvo5u9 
http://tinyurl.com/zpop9n9

attributes.action: Give the local authority the power to direct academy schools to take a child.
attributes.background: Our 8 year old son with additional needs suffered sustained & violent bullying from a child over 4 years culminating in a significant mental health breakdown. The school can not & will not deal with the bullying. We now cannot get our son into a new school.
attributes.additional_details: Our son was removed from school to safeguard him as the school we were moving him to had conceded an appeal to take him meaning only out of school for 2 weeks, only for the new school to then rescind the offer, two further schools will now not accept him, all three sighting they require an educational health care plan to review first. No agency appears to be interested to grip this, EFA have sent it back to the local authority who have no authority over academies. 106 days out of education now.

attributes.action: Change Just in Case medication policy to Debbiebox a NHS Standard practice in GP
attributes.background: My mum spent 4 hour dying in pain due to MAR chart missing. Ambulance Crew couldn't give drugs needed. My mum died hospital 1hr pain free. I had to watch her. Just in Case box is NOT standard practice. We want a Debbiebox in place in every GP with MAR, DNS and drugs and comes direct from GP.
attributes.additional_details:
The MAR charts was not requested at my GP and was missed out.  District nurse request a JUST IN CASE BOX. This GP didn't have a box policy.

The Debbiebox is a palliative care box which will have telephone numbers, drugs, MAR chart and DNR form, syringes it will be done by a GP alone.

Currently each GP has their own policy it should be standard practice so no miscommunication happens resulting in mistakes and someone dying in pain. 
This would stop compensation claims and is cost effective.

attributes.action: The Government ignores the EU and starts to negotiate and sign trade deals now
attributes.background: Article 50 is intended to cause restrictions and harms the UK economy.  We need to sign new deals before the EU imposes a deal on us that requires the UK economy to start from scratch at the end of the 2 year period.  We need to start now to get deals as an incentive for the EU to give a good deal.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has always been fastidious in following the rules though they are often ignored by Germany and France.  We are leaving the EU and there is no longer a moral need to keep to these rules.  By not setting up new deals NOW we risk leaving the EU with only the deal that the EU wishes to give us.  We need to replace the trade with the EU with other trade pacts that will give the EU the incentive to give us a fair trade deal beneficial to both sides.

attributes.action: I want to see a mandatory Driving ban for using a mobile device when driving.
attributes.background: People are being killed on the roads in the UK due to irresponsible motorists using mobile devices whilst driving. The law should be changed to ensure that any motorist using a mobile device whilst driving should receive an automatic driving disqualification of 6 months for a first time offence.
attributes.additional_details: A driver who recently killed three children and a woman whilst he was distracted whilst using his mobile device received a ten year custodial sentence. He had previously been warned about using a mobile device whilst driving by his employers yet he still continued to flout the law.

attributes.action: Let private hire vehicles use bus lanes just like black cabs can
attributes.background: We as private hire drivers do the same job as bus drivers and black cab drivers so why ain't we allowed to use bus lanes

attributes.action: Stop agencies fining those who cannot attend work because of an emergency
attributes.background: Agencies are currently able to issue fines to workers if they do not give 48 hours prior notice that they are unable to attend a shift. If they have an emergency or illness in that 48 hour window they will be fined, whether or not they provide a reason.
attributes.additional_details:
One agency that does this is ROTA, which provides hospitality staff. Given that it is illegal to handle food within 48 hours of diarrhoea or vommiting you could effectively be fined for abiding by the law. 

It is outrageous to fine some of the lowest paid in our society. They already give up a lot of rights by having to take zero hour contracts, and to fine those in the most precarious of employment is deplorable.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell tickets for more than 25% the face value!
attributes.background:
So today I tried to buy Red Hot Chilli Pepper tickets but at exactly 10am there were no tickets available. I was directed to ticketmasters sister site 'getmein' where the tickets were over 50% the original face value. 
We want to support the band, we do not want to support the touts!

attributes.action: To consider protecting CC41&11011 the historic symbols under IPO article 6_ter
attributes.background: I would like you to consider protecting the historic expired marks CC41 and 11011 under article 6_ter or equivalent Non EU regulation so that it remains free to use by the people and not that of sole property of an individual so that they are able to gain financial reward.
attributes.additional_details: It recently came to my attention that an individual has successfully published the iconic CC41, I intend to fully challange the Mark personally and have appealed and invited the millions of Brits to join me in this campaign,  so that the trademark CC41 is not granted solely to the individual Mr Douglas Steward, further information of this can be found on the IPO website under the words "CC41" The double 11s symbol 11011, another iconic symbol I also wish you to consider protecting.

attributes.action: Hold a general Election in 2016 after the decision was made to leave the EU
attributes.background: The run up to the EU referendum has managed to prove that the Conservative government are not all of the same ideologies. In a time of vulnerability and Especially now the UK has to stand alone we need a Prime Minister that shows stability and integrity.

attributes.action:
Save HMS Hermes.
Rescue her from the scrap yard and bring her home.
attributes.background:
HMS Hermes served for over 30 years and was the flag ship during the Falklands conflict in 1982. She has been recently decommissioned by the indian navy and is now destined for the scrap yard.
She is a significant piece of the Royal Navy's history in the same class as HMS Victory and HMS Belfast.
attributes.additional_details: HMS Hermes could become a great floating museum and business and educational centre.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a mother to deny contact with a child's father
attributes.background: Many mothers denying fathers having contact with there child for no reason what so ever! If the father is willing to step up and support there child, be there for them and care for them then why stop access?

attributes.action: Make publishing a false statement illegal
attributes.background: A publication that makes a factually incorrect statement – for whatever reason – and is proved to have done so, will have to publish a correction in the same prominence, location and size as the original false statement.
attributes.additional_details:
In a democracy, the key for debating and arguing ideas is a respect for the facts on which we base our opinions and views of the world. It’s the level playing field we must all respect. Opinions, predictions, and forecasts are quite different and would not be covered by such a law so long as they are clearly noted as such.  

This proposed law is not intended to cover persons as that is already covered by the law of slander and libel.

attributes.action: Offer all new parents the chance to learn lifesaving baby CPR
attributes.background:
In an unresponsive child, the first few minutes of first aid that is administered can be the difference between life & death.
If parents were given the opportunity to learn lifesaving CPR skills, more infant deaths could be prevented.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently attended a first aid course. To see someone preform CPR on a small, lifeless baby (in this case it was just a training doll) hit me hard. I have three children. My youngest is just under a year old. And in an emergency, before that day, I wouldn't have known what to do. 
The skills I learnt that day made me realise all new parents should be offered basic training as part of the many after care checks taken by health professionals. One day, that parent may end up having to use it.

attributes.action: Introduce Government subsidies on public transport for full time students.
attributes.background: Studying in full time education can cost families a sufficient amount of money each year on transport to school and recreational activities which they may not have. This can cost families and students thousands of pounds every year which they can spend on other costs in the household like books.
attributes.additional_details: For a bus ticket from Seaton to Exeter it costs a student £10 for a return trip which the money can be used for a text book from school.Therefore  the government should subsidie public transport for students in full time education.

attributes.action: Enforce disabled access in the UK rather than ignoring the issue
attributes.background:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable adjustments.

Its time the UK took action to make disabled access mandatory in all businesses and for those who fail to be fined by their local authority.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable 
adjustments for disabled people to have equal access to their services.

Its time councils had the power to issue fines, warnings and even court action against businesses that fail to comply with disability access law. Too little is being done to enforce this and a good number of disabled people do not have the energy to take these issues through court.

attributes.action: Allow foreign nationals who are UK citizens of 3 yrs+ equal voting rights.
attributes.background: There are many foreign nationals living and working in the UK who have built businesses, set up families, own homes and who thus contribute to the UK economy in a way which should allow them a say regarding important decisions that affect them, such as the EU.

attributes.action: The UK should negotiate with Australia to form a union between the two nations.
attributes.background:
If Scotland leaves the union England will be weaker on the world stage. The economy will fall, quality of life will plummet, etc. 
I propose a debate that involves the UK parliament to negotiate with the Australian parliament to form a union between the two.

attributes.action: Putting signs on bridges and potential suicide spots offering support and hope.
attributes.background: Imagine feeling that there is no hope left in life, nothing to live for. These thoughts go through peoples heads daily and they consequently end their lives. Some people may have no one to talk to, but there are services that can help. I believe putting the information out there will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics show that suicide is the biggest single killer of men under the age of 45. 
The idea of having signs has already been done in Japans Aokigahara Forest, where hundreds of people have gone to commit suicide. There are now signs which read  "Your life is something precious that was given to you by your parents" while another one states ''Do not be troubled alone." What i'm suggesting is signs with The Samaritans and other local mental health services details on to contact. There is help.

attributes.action: Proclaim a UK Bank Holiday to celebrate HM The Queen's 90th birthday year.
attributes.background: The Queen's official birthday will fall on Saturday 11th June in 2016, marking Her Majesty's 90th birthday. This is a wonderful moment for our nation and will be marked with public holidays around the Commonwealth and with the closure of British High Commissions and Embassies. The UK should join in!
attributes.additional_details: Around the world, Commonwealth nations and oversees UK territories will celebrate with public holidays on either Fri 10th June or Mon 13th June. This petition calls for the same opportunity for the United Kingdom at some point between June 2016 and June 2017, the 90th year of The Queen's life.

attributes.action: Abolish the 1 hour clock changes in March and October and introduce double BST
attributes.background:
The clocks going back in October is shown to increase road accidents, crime, and mental health conditions such as SAD due to the darker nights. 
Double BST would put us at GMT+1 in winter, and GMT+2 in summer, bringing us into line with Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the RoSPA, more people are killed and injured in road accidents due to the darker Autumn and winter evenings. 
Cambridge university estimates 450,000 tonnes of carbon emissions saved per year. 
It would align the UK with European times, aiding businesses. 
It would boost tourism that is dependent on daylight hours by up to two months a year. 
It would shift the average year long sunset time from 18:35 to 19:30, giving an average of 55minutes per day of extra light in the evenings.

attributes.action: Scrap Tax on Savings Income altogether, NOT just the 1st £1000
attributes.background: As Interest rates on 'Savings Accounts' are at record lows currently, people are now struggling to live off their savings incomes, which the government taxes after the 1st £1000 income at 20%.
attributes.additional_details: The government can easily scrap this tax for savers, forever, in the next Budget, also, would save a lot of people having to complete the Self-Assessment to repay Savings Income above £1000.

attributes.action: Improve the A21. Eliminate blindspots and place speed cameras along Kent street
attributes.background: There have been a number of fatalities along Kent street in 2016. One being on the 13 of August. Vast stretches of the a21 are seriously outdated and need improving. I'm asking that the government improve the a21 especially Kent street, by eke imitating blindspots and placing average speed cameras.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of letters to the government by residents of Kent street asking for changes, but nothing has been done. All the plans to improve the a21 have been shelved, and I'm asking that the government step in and change the road. 4 fatalities this year are evidence that something needs to be done.

attributes.action: To make sure all voulunteers on school trips are DBS/CRB checked
attributes.background: A primary school child, as young as 4 years can legally go on a school trip in a group of 6 children with one career. The career can be anyone connected to the school i.e parent, grandparent, a parents partner etc. The volunteers do not legally have to be DBS checked.
attributes.additional_details: A primary school child, as young as 4 years can legally go on a school trip in a group of 6 children with one career. The career can be anyone connected to the school i.e parent, grandparent, a parents partner etc. The volunteers do not legally have to be DBS checked. This means that the person caring for a child for the day could have anything on their criminal record and the school would not know about this.

attributes.action: Unemployment and behaviour rehabilitation.  National service.
attributes.background:
1. Children/Adults on leaving school will be enrolled in a national service programme if they are not in employment or further education with 3 months of leaving school.

2. Young offenders 16-25 are entered into the national service programme for rehabilitation.
attributes.additional_details:
1a. They will recieve a set of skills and further education for a good platform in life and to be a working citizen.
1b. They recieve a wage which pays taxes back not benefits.
1c. Money taken and put into a fund for them when service is finished to help them with a start in life.

2a. Takes down over crowding in prisons.
2b. Gives them a set of skills and trade to give back something to community's. Something were they feel wanted.
2c. Reduces tax payers costs to prisoners.
2d. Pays taxes back.

attributes.action: Brexit should NOT include free movement of people or contributions to EU funds.
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU and should not pay into it. They need to trade with us more than we need them.

attributes.action: Include cats on the reportable accident list like dogs and larger animals.
attributes.background: In less than 2 years I have had 3 cats killed after being hit by cars.  All 3 of my cats have just been left either in the road or at the side of the road and nobody has had the decency to let me know. I think it is about time that accidents involving cats should be reported as is the law with dogs.
attributes.additional_details: By letting the owner know that their beloved pet has been hit could be the difference between the cat surviving or passing away, those few minutes after an accident are crucial and could give the pet owner time to get to the vets and potentially save the cats life! I know this will not bring my cats back and it wont prevent more accidents.  But it would mean not so many people lose their pets if they can get them to the vets in time.

attributes.action: Increase the penalty for those involved in the puppy farm trade.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is one of the largest contributors of animal cruelty within Britain. No animal should have to go through the distress and abusive conditions that happen within this barbaric industry. Those who take part in this trade should suffer a heavy penalty for this act of cruelty.

attributes.action: Make websites and social media accounts glamorizing anorexia a criminal offense.
attributes.background: The number of people with eating disorders is currently rising at an estimate of 7% a year largely due to social media and the extent of material promoting eating disorders. Consequently I feel that by increasing controls we can reduce the number of people developing this potentially deadly disease.
attributes.additional_details:
Often individuals creating these inappropriate accounts and websites do not realize the extent of the impact of their actions and the devastating affects it has on many people's lives. Eating disorders can ruin people's lives, destroy relationships; hospitalize people and ultimately kill them and I strongly believe it is something that needs tackling now before the problem becomes any greater. 
https://www.b-eat.co.uk/about-beat/media-centre/information-and-statistics-about-eating-disorders

attributes.action: Make the provision of free public toilets a legal requirement for local councils
attributes.background: Public toilets are not legally require to be provided by local authorities, which means that they are often closed to save money. As urinating or defecating on the street is illegal it effectively means that a person has to spend money in a private establishment in order to use the toilets.
attributes.additional_details:
"Joan Dean said her husband Brian, who has Parkinson's Disease, was left humiliated when he wet himself after failing to find a toilet on a trip to Levenshulme, in Manchester, where 18 toilets have been closed in the last 10 years."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36405414

People who are vulnerable, ill, homeless or on low income might not be able to use private facilities yet face legal action if they urinate or defecate on the street. This is an affront to dignity and needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Increase free and confidential mental health support for students aged 13-25
attributes.background: Recently there have been drastic cuts to mental health services, even though many school students are affected by mental illness; this need has been further heightened by an increase of suicide in universities.

attributes.action: Conduct a 2nd, more complex, EU membership referendum with multiple answers.
attributes.background: The first EU membership referendum had polarised wording and lacked options which truly reflected the range of sentiment toward the EU found across the UK. To empower the people, a more complex range of possible outcomes should be provided which serves both the voter and the EU/next generation.
attributes.additional_details: 1st EU referendum.

attributes.action: Abolish same roof rule and 1979 rule for historic sexual abuse victims
attributes.background: If you were abused by a family member living in the same household the Ministry of Justice thinks that's ok. If your abuse ended prior to October 1979 that's ok too. The CICA will not pay out any form of compensation if you fall into either of these categories, an unfair and unjust rule.
attributes.additional_details: My father and mother were recently jailed for what he did to me as a child I and my sisters were told to make a claim for compensation. We did but as my abuse ended in July 1979 and it was my father that sexually abused me the law says it was ok and I am entitled to nothing. This is not about the money this is about another slap in the face for abuse victims coming forward it needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Repeal part of the Legal Services Act 2007 to abolish the SRA and LSB
attributes.background: The Legal Services Act 2007 imposed a highly complex structure for regulation of solicitors.  It is expensive to run and gave the public no greater protections.  If regulation can revert to The Law Society (supervised by the Ministry of Justice), the money saved can be used to finance legal aid.

attributes.action: Hold a Parliamentary debate on Social Media Abuse
attributes.background: Social media abuse, including cyberbulling, trolling, sexting and grooming, are negatively affecting thousands of teenagers' lives on a daily basis, culminating in self harm, alcoholism, mental illness and suicide. We wish for the companies responsible to take additional steps to police their sites.
attributes.additional_details: The NSPCC, along with Barnados, have a huge amount of data highlighting the serious issues teenagers are dealing with when becoming victims of social media abuse. Not enough safeguards are deployed within these sites to deal with the amount of abuse aimed at our children which leave parents in total despair. The level of abuse affects our children in many ways with poor exam results, disengagement within society, drug and alcohol abuse, eating disorders and in some cases self harm and suicide.

attributes.action: An unelected Prime Minister should call a general election within 6 months
attributes.background: In the interests of sovereignty, an unelected UK Prime Minister should hold a general election within six months of taking office.

attributes.action: Decrease the amount universities can charge students for their tuition fees.
attributes.background: It is well known how much debt students will be left with once they have graduated from their respective degrees. It is time for parliament to review the maximum amount of tuition fees being charged to students in the U.K, as well as offering more financial support to those from low income families.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-34721681
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-26954901
http://www.independent.co.uk/student/news/jeremy-corbyn-england-should-be-utterly-ashamed-of-having-highest-tuition-fees-in-industrialised-a6860556.html

attributes.action: Accept the BSA's offer of integrating lone refugee children into private schools
attributes.background:
"More than 220,000 have arrived in Europe this year, seeking safety and a better future. One in three is a child." - Unicef

In May 2016, the BSA (Boarding School's Association) offered the government more than 80 fully-funded places in private schools across Britain. They have been unfilled. Why?
attributes.additional_details: As poignant images and testimonies from refugees who have sacrificed everything to make the arduous journey become ever more common, many choose to avert their eyes in fear of the realisation that they could have done more. The British Government is among those who could do more - for a nation which has long prided itself on charity and helping those less fortunate, the paltry number is a farce. Urge them to collaborate with the BSA to restore this nation as one of the world's leading lights.

attributes.action: Regulate agency fees for tenants in the letting market to reduce excessive fees.
attributes.background: Letting agencies vary widely in the fees they charge from company to company and by region. It is often unclear exactly what you are paying for. High reference fees, checkout fees, and other charges, on top of depoisits, are unfair to tenants and make moving home unaffordable to many.

attributes.action: Reduce the validity period of Energy Performance Certificates to 1 year.
attributes.background: When selling or renting a property an EPC must be produced and provided to any potential buyer or tenant prior to the property being marketed. Currently the certificate is valid for 10 years and can be very misleading as a property rating may have increased or decreased due to modifications.
attributes.additional_details: It is my opinion that the EPC provided to the property purchaser or tenant should be an up to date document giving the current rating of the property. The EPC should be no more than 6 months old to give a true reflection of current running costs and an up to date reflection of the current heating system and insulation measures.

attributes.action: Amend the Harassment Act 1997 to stop criminalisation of those with disabilities
attributes.background: The clauses that were inserted into the amended version of the act has resulted in individuals that lack social understanding/capacity due to a disability being criminalised under this law reform. The act states that a person ‘ought to know their actions amounted to harassment of another’.
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals with these types of conditions lack social understanding. 
There needs to be an alternative to criminalising these individuals.

‘It costs £65,000 to process an individual through the criminal justice system.  According to the Focus Prisoner Education website, ‘prisoners with health conditions cost more on top of that standard figure to accommodate in prison’ (Focus Prisoner Education, 2015, http://www.fpe.org.uk).

attributes.action: Amend Shortage Occupation rules that are blocking the hiring of Specialist Chefs
attributes.background: UK's Asian cuisine industry is lacking skill ready Professional Chefs. Though Chefs are on government's Shortage Occupation list it disqualifies restaurants that allow collection or delivery of restaurant meals as NOT having specialist skill needs in spite of this involving the same skill input
attributes.additional_details:
The industry is in urgent need of experienced skill ready Chefs from outside EU on temporary basis to support business operations, and to enable training and development of home grown Chefs. However this is being prevented by inappropriate rules. This petition calls for following amendments to the Shortage Occupation rules 

1. Remove the 'take away' clause

2. Raise skill recognition to NQF level 6  

3. Amend minimum salary to £25,000 

4. Allow temporary non settlement based UK entry

attributes.action: Ban the production and selling of mink lashes!
attributes.background: Mink eyelashes are a growing trend,but these animals are put through a huge amount of pain just for there fur. The animals are kept in confind cages and factory's. None of this is humane. All for humans to look "nice" while these animals have no say if people can use there fur,and through pain.
attributes.additional_details: No use of animal fur is humane.

attributes.action: To guarantee the rights of EU nationals in the UK and UK nationals in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, the futures of EU nationals living in the UK and UK nationals living in EU countries are completely unknown. We demand that they are allowed to remain in the country of their choice.
attributes.additional_details: This petition does not seek to overturn the recent referendum result or request a second referendum.  It simply seeks to ensure that any Brexit deal guarantees the residency and employment rights of EU nationals living in Britain and Britons living in other EU countries which are not currently guaranteed. This has left many individuals and their families uncertain of their futures.

attributes.action: Increase payment for Early Years Education Funding
attributes.background: As a self funded Pre School and with the rising wage costs along with upcoming work pensions we along with many other pre schools are finding sustainably impossible. Funding that we rely on has not increased to cover these costs. We fear closure leading to no places for children in the future.
attributes.additional_details: We have to have a certain amount of staff per group of children who all need to be paid at least the minimum wage. We are self funded. Incoming money funds staff costs, rent, phone, equipment & resources, HMRC, Ofsted, insurances, food etc. Cash flow forecasts shows we will not be able to sustain provision in the near future if funding is not increased, leaving children without a place and parents without childcare & staff without an income.

attributes.action: We are calling on the Govt to strip Thameslink Govia of their rail franchise.
attributes.background: Govia Thameslink has the highest number of passenger journeys but the lowest customer satisfaction rates and the lowest PPM of any UK rail network. There has been a continuous decline in their PPM measure since 2015. They have the second highest rate of cancellation & significantly late running.
attributes.additional_details:
Thameslink Govia's poor management is evident in:
The lack of adequate contingency plans to cope with disruption.
Poor & inaccurate information provided to customers 
The ongoing staffing disputes without major disruption to the network. 
Continually increasing fares with declining service levels

We urge the government to urgently review the situation and award the franchise to a company which can deliver a consistent, good level of service.

attributes.action: Provide a clear and open way to reply to government responses to petitions
attributes.background: The petitions website was set up as a way for the electorate to influence policy and hold the government to account. While this is an excellent tool for improving communication between the public and the government, the responses are frequently dismissive with no recourse for the public to reply.
attributes.additional_details:
When responses are dismissive or ignore the core concerns of the people, it increases disillusionment and leads to disenfranchisement. In order to improve the power of this democratic tool to hold the government to account, there needs to be a clear, open and visible way for the public to reply to the government responses. 

Please provide a way for the public to reply and engage with government responses to improve the power of this tool.

attributes.action: Cancel the Validity of the EU referendum as the government held it illegally.
attributes.background: No votes for European residents but votes for Commonwealth residents. None for long standing Brits living elsewhere in the EU. The result is too marginal to call decisive. The 2 million EU citizens working and living  in the UK directly affected by this should be given a vote at a new referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Referendums are one off events, so the rules about who can vote are different each time. www.electoralcommission.org.uk

Millions of EU UK Citizens have helped this country be the success it has been. A set of voting eligibility rules should have been laid out for EU citizens who have been here a certain amount of time, made the UK their home and contributed.

attributes.action: Motorcycle filtering signs.
attributes.background: to lower the risk of deaths and near misses on the UK motorways, filtering signs to be placed on the gang ways above motorways or on the side of roads informing other motorists to look out for bikes. Also stipulate the legal filtering speed limits in the highway code.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the amount of motorcycle deaths and/or near misses on the UK roads down to filtering, as a road safety intensive nation wide I feel the government should introduce a filtering sign along UK roads, to remind other road users of filtering bikes and the legalities (stated in section 88 of the highway code) to be move vigilant for filtering motorcycles.
